title: Introduction to Mediation, Moderation, and Conditional Process Analysis : a Regression-Based Approach
subject: Sciences sociales -- Méthodes statistiques
Médiation statistique
Analyse de régression

Mediation (Statistics)

creator: Hayes, Andrew F.$$QHayes, Andrew F.
publisher: New York, NY : The Guilford Press
description: This book explains fundamentals of mediation and moderation analysis and their integration as conditional process analysis. Procedures are described for testing hypotheses about the mechanisms by which causal effects operate, the conditions under which they occur, and the moderation of mechanisms. Relying on the principles of ordinary least squares regression, the author explains the estimation and interpretation of direct and indirect effects, probing and visualization of interactions, and testing of questions about moderated mediation. Examples using data from published studies illustrate how to conduct and report the analyses described in the book. Of special value, the book introduces and documents PROCESS, a macro for SPSS and SAS that does all the computations described in the book. The author's website (www.afhayes.com) offers free downloads of PROCESS plus data files for the book's examples.--publisher's description.
series: Methodology in the social sciences$$QMethodology in the social sciences
Methodology in the social sciences.$$QMethodology in the social sciences.
contents: Fundamental concepts. Introduction ; Simple linear regression ; Multiple linear regression -- Mediation analysis. The simple mediation model ; Multiple mediator models ; Miscellaneous topics in mediation analysis -- Moderation analysis. Fundamentals of moderation analysis ; Extending moderation analysis principles ; Miscellaneous topics in moderation analysis -- Conditional process analysis. Fundamentals of conditional process analysis ; Further examples of conditional process analysis ; Miscellaneous topics in conditional process analysis.
